citations.narrative:
Five weaned puppies were in an enclosure that measured 31.25 inches by 47.25 inches for a total of 1,476.5625 square
inches of the space. The five puppies measured 12 inches, 12.5 inches, 13 inches, 13 inches, and 14.5 inches. Together
these five puppies required 1,808.5 square inches of space. The enclosure was short in space by 331.9375 square
inches of space.
Cage space requirements ensure that the dogs have enough room to move about freely within their enclosures. It
minimizes the dogs from stepping or sitting in their feces or urine and also minimizes the spread of disease. The licensee
must ensure that all enclosures containing dogs and puppies have enough floor space to meet the minimum floor space
requirements for the number of and the size of the dogs in that enclosure.
Correct starting on 4/4/23.

The licensee is not currently vaccinating his adult dogs for rabies, distemper, or parvo. In addition, he is not sampling for
fecal parasites or heartworm. Not vaccinating all adult dogs for rabies, distemper, and parvo and not sampling the adult
dogs for parasites doesn't ensure the dogs are adequately protected from various diseases and parasites. All adult dogs
must be vaccinated for distemper, parvo, and rabies and must be sampled for parasites in accordance with a plan from
the Attending Veterinarian. Correct by 5/4/23.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End of report.
n

narrative:
3.6(c)(1)(i) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
Five weaned puppies were in an enclosure that measured 31.25 inches by 47.25 inches for a total of 1,476.5625 square 
inches of the space.  The five puppies measured 12 inches, 12.5 inches, 13 inches, 13 inches, and 14.5 inches.  Together 
these five puppies required 1,808.5 square inches of space.  The enclosure was short in space by 331.9375 square 
inches of space. 
 
Cage space requirements ensure that the dogs have enough room to move about freely within their enclosures. It 
minimizes the dogs from stepping or sitting in their feces or urine and also minimizes the spread of disease. The licensee 
must ensure that all enclosures containing dogs and puppies have enough floor space to meet the minimum floor space 
requirements for the number of and the size of the dogs in that enclosure. 
 
Correct starting on 4/4/23. 
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The licensee is not currently vaccinating his adult dogs for rabies, distemper, or parvo.  In addition, he is not sampling for 
fecal parasites or heartworm.  Not vaccinating all adult dogs for rabies, distemper, and parvo and not sampling the adult

dogs for parasites doesn't ensure the dogs are adequately protected from various diseases and parasites.  All adult dogs 
must be vaccinated for distemper, parvo, and rabies and must be sampled for parasites in accordance with a plan from 
the Attending Veterinarian.  Correct by 5/4/23. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
End of report. 
 
 n
